bibl.title: Letter from H.C. Woodfall to Henry Rose Carter, October 22, 1921

div1.p: Woodfall asks Carter to review the bill before Georgia Legislature regarding impounded waters.

div1.head: Letter from H.C. Woodfall to Henry Rose Carter, October 22, 1921
div1.opener:
Imp'd Water
Legislation
STATE OF GEORGIA
1776
STATE BOARD OF HEALTH
DIVISION OF SANITARY ENGINEERING
ATLANTA
T. F. ABERCROMBIE, M. D.,
SECRETARY AND COMMISSIONER
OF HEALTH
H. C. WOODFALL, DIRECTOR,
DIVISION OF SANITARY ENGI-
NEERING AND WATER ANALYSIS
Atlanta, Ga.,
Oct. 22, 1921.
Dr. H. R. Carter, Asst. Sur. General,
U. S. Public Health Service,
2121 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Doctor Carter,-
div1.p:
I wish to acknowledge receipt
of a letter sent to you by Dr. Griffiths in rela-
tion to legislation in Georgia on Impounded Waters.

I am enclosing a copy of a bill which
was placed before the Legislature last year and was
tabled, due to the fact that the Legislature did not
have time during its session to pass on certain of
the later bills that came before them. I will appre-
ciate it very much if you will look over this bill
and make any suggestions or corrections which you
think advisable.

I wish to thank you for your interest in
this matter and your offer for cooperation in the same.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, H. C. Woodfall, Director. HCW:HFS.
Encl. 1.
